head.title: DataBank: APRIL 23-27; The Dow Zips Past 13,000 (and Doesn't Stop)

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: DataBank: APRIL 23-27; The Dow Zips Past 13,000 (and Doesn't Stop)
hedline.hl2: The Dow Zips Past 13,000 (and Doesnâ€™t Stop)

block.p: The Dow Jones industrial average broke through the 13,000 barrier for the first time on Wednesday and kept going. By the close of trading on Friday, it had reached 13,120.94, a new record.

Corporate earnings that outstripped Wall Street expectations helped fuel the advance, despite some troubling economic data. On Friday, the Commerce Department reported that the gross domestic product in the first quarter grew at an annualized rate of 1.3 percent, much lower than in the previous quarter. And inflation, as measured by the G.D.P. price index, surged at a 4 percent annualized rate.
The Dow Jones industrial average broke through the 13,000 barrier for the first time on Wednesday and kept going. By the close of trading on Friday, it had reached 13,120.94, a new record.
The Dow Jones industrial average broke through the 13,000 barrier for the first time on Wednesday and kept going. By the close of trading on Friday, it had reached 13,120.94, a new record.

Corporate earnings that outstripped Wall Street expectations helped fuel the advance, despite some troubling economic data. On Friday, the Commerce Department reported that the gross domestic product in the first quarter grew at an annualized rate of 1.3 percent, much lower than in the previous quarter. And inflation, as measured by the G.D.P. price index, surged at a 4 percent annualized rate.

But the Dow closed at record highs on three consecutive days. I.B.M., which announced that it would buy back another $15 billion worth of its own shares, rose 7 percent for the week, the best performance among the 30 Dow industrials.

For the week, the Dow gained 158.96 points, or 1.2 percent, to close at 13,120.94. The Standard & Poor's 500-stock index rose 9.72 points, or 0.7 percent, to close at 1,494.07. The Nasdaq composite climbed 30.82 points, 1.2 percent, to close at 2,557.21. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose to 4.69 percent from 4.67 percent the previous week.
